info.title: Corporate Lending Alternative Reference Rates
info.x-finastra-short-description: Provides an Alternative Reference Rates (ARR) Calculator Service to applications that are unable to calculate their own ARR based interest accruals
info.description: Set of Alternative Reference Rates (ARR) Calculator APIs enabling calculation of key ARR rates and corresponding accrued interest amounts, using various ARR Calculation methods for a given interest period and given ARR Conventions, based on the published ARR rates or Compounded ARR Index.

get.summary: Calculated Rate - Using Daily Compounded in Arrears (NCCR)
get.description: Calculates the ARR rates based on Daily Compounding in Arrears (Non-Cumulative Compounded Rate) for the provided start/end dates (such as interest period dates) and other ARR parameters, by leveraging the daily published risk-free reference rate.

parameters.name: interestPeriodStartDate
parameters.description: The start date of the interest period from (and including) which the ARR Compounding Calculation should be performed.</br>The date is in ISO 8601 Date Format yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: interestPeriodEndDate
parameters.description: The end date of the interest period to (and including) which the ARR compounding calculation should be performed.</BR> The date is in ISO 8601 Date Format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: riskFreeRate
parameters.description: The name of the Risk Free Rate/Alternative Reference Rate.

parameters.name: riskFreeRateFloor
parameters.description: The Floor value (as a percentage) for the published risk-free reference rate. Accepts upto 6 decimal points.</br> Minimum Value = -100, Maximum Value = 100

parameters.name: lookBackDays
parameters.description: Lookback days refers to the fixed date (business days prior to) from which the calculator is expected to use the published Risk Free Rate/Alternative Reference Rate </BR>Minimum Value = 0, Maximum Value = 99

parameters.name: observationPeriodShift
parameters.description: Indicates whether Observation Period Shift is applicable or not. Not supported if lockout days is non zero or interest period start/end date are non-business day.

parameters.name: rateRoundingDecimalPoints
parameters.description: Rounds the calculated ARR Compounded Rate and Compounding Factor to the specified decimal precision.</BR>Minimum Value = 2, Maximum Value = 12 </br>Default value: for SOFR = 5, for SONIA = 4

parameters.name: dayCountConvention
parameters.description: The Day Count Conventions supported. Valid value are - ACT/360, ACT/365 & ACT/ACT.</br> Default Value: for SOFR= ACT/360, for SONIA = ACT/365

parameters.name: lockoutDays
parameters.description: Lockout days refers to the period (business days) in which the applicable ARR is derived using Lookback days and applied to all the days defined as Lockout days</BR> Minimum Value = 0, Maximum Value = 99

parameters.name: showDailyDetails
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Calculated Compounded Rates in the output appear for all business days (Value = True) OR only for the calculateTillDate or last business day for the interest period (Value = False), based on whether calculateTillDate is outside the rates-known window or not, respectively.

parameters.name: calculateTillDate
parameters.description: The Date upto (and including) which the calculated compounded rates are expected in the output. The date is in ISO 8601 Date Format yyyy-mm-dd.
